Method Detail

stringToDate

public static java.util.Date stringToDate(java.lang.String strDate,
                                          java.text.DateFormat format)
                                   throws java.text.ParseException
Transforms the given string into a date. The string must follow the format as presented by the given format parameter. If the string has another format then ParseException is raised.

Parameters:
strDate - The string to convert to a date.
format - A SimpleDateFormat object that describes the strDate.
Returns:
The date corresponding to the given strDate or null if the strDate is null.
Throws:
java.text.ParseException - If the strDate doesn't match the format as defined by the 'format' parameter.

stringToDate

public static java.util.Date stringToDate(java.lang.String strDate,
                                          java.lang.String format)
                                   throws java.text.ParseException
Transforms the given string into a date. The string must follow the format as presented by the given format parameter. If the string has another format then ParseException is raised. This method is simply a convenience method.

Parameters:
strDate - The string to convert to a date.
format - A string that describes the strDate.
Returns:
Date
Throws:
java.text.ParseException - If the strDate doesn't match the format as defined by the 'format' parameter.

Returns true if the given hours, when added to the current time, does not carry over to the next day; false otherwise.

convertUnixTstampDate

public static java.util.Date convertUnixTstampDate(long gmtTstamp)
This method converts a UNIX Timstamp to a locallized Date object.

Parameters:
gmtTstamp - UNIX Timestamp (in seconds from Epoch).
Returns:
UNIX timestamp as a new Date in the local timezone
